kuusisto.tinysound.internal
Class SoundReference

java.lang.Object
  kuusisto.tinysound.internal.SoundReference

public class SoundReference
extends Object

The SoundReference class is the Mixers interface to the audio data of a Sound object. SoundReference is an internal class of the TinySound system and should be of no real concern to the average user of TinySound.

Author:
Finn Kuusisto

SoundReference

public SoundReference(byte[] left,
                      byte[] right,
                      double volume,
                      int soundID)
Construct a new SoundReference with the given reference data.

Parameters:
left - left channel of sound data
right - right channel of sound data
volume - volume at which to play the sound
soundID - ID of the Sound for which this is a reference

Get the next byte from the sound data.

Parameters:

nextTwoBytes

public void nextTwoBytes(int[] data,
                         boolean bigEndian)
Get the next two bytes from the sound data in the specified endianness.

Parameters:
data - length-2 array to write in next two bytes from each channel
bigEndian - true if the bytes should be read big-endian
